intro: Staphidiastrum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf staphidiastrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
